Left lower motor neuron facial weakness and numbness of the left face indicate involvement of the ipsilateral facial and trigeminal pathways; concurrent right-sided spastic hemiparesis with brisk reflexes and upgoing plantar response localises to interruption of descending motor fibres above the decussation. Gaze-evoked nystagmus and unsteady gait are compatible with neighbouring pontocerebellar or vestibular pathway involvement. A single unilateral pontine lesion parsimoniously explains these crossed cranial nerve and long-tract signs.
